soc.game
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  soc.game.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

This is a representation of the board in Settlers of Catan. Board initialization is done in makeNewBoard(Hashtable); that method has some internal comments on structures, coordinates, layout and values.

Other methods to examine the board: Game.getPlayersOnHex(int), Game.putPiece(PlayingPiece), etc.

Coordinate system, as seen in appendix A of Robert S Thomas' dissertation:

Hexes (represented as coordinate of their centers), nodes (corners of hexes; where settlements/cities are placed), and edges (between nodes; where roads are placed), share the same grid of coordinates. Each hex is 2 units wide, in a 2-D coordinate system. The first axis runs northwest to southeast; the second runs southwest to northeast. Having six sides, hexes run in a straight line west to east, separated by vertical edges; both coordinates increase along a west-to-east line.

Current coordinate encoding: (BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL)
All coordinates are encoded as two-digit hex integers, one digit per axis (thus 00 to FF). The center hex is encoded as 77; see the dissertation PDF's appendix for diagrams. Unfortunately this format means the board can't be expanded without changing its encoding, which is used across the network.

Author:
Robert S Thomas
See Also:

Constant Field Values

FACING_NE

public static final int FACING_NE
Facing is the direction (1-6) to the hex touching a hex or edge. Facing 1 is NE, 2 is E, 3 is SE, 4 is SW, etc; used in hexLayout for ports, and elsewhere.
      6 <--.    .--> 1
            \/\/
            /  \
       5<--|    |--> 2
           |    |
            \  /
            /\/\
      4 <--.    .--> 3

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constant Field Values

BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL

public static final int BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL
Original format (1) for getBoardEncodingFormat(): Hexadecimal 0x00 to 0xFF along 2 diagonal axes. Coordinate range on each axis is 0 to 15 decimal. In hex:
   Hexes: 11 to DD
   Nodes: 01 or 10, to FE or EF
   Edges: 00 to EE

See the Dissertation PDF for details.

Since:
1.1.06
See Also:
Constant Field Values

BOARD_ENCODING_6PLAYER

public static final int BOARD_ENCODING_6PLAYER
6-player format (2) for getBoardEncodingFormat(): Land hexes are same encoding as BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL. Land starts 1 extra hex west of standard board, and has an extra row of land at north and south end. Ports are not part of hexLayout because their coordinates wouldn't fit within 2 hex digits. Instead, see getPortTypeFromNodeCoord(int), getPortCoordinates(int) or getPortsLayout().

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int MAX_BOARD_ENCODING
Largest value of getBoardEncodingFormat() supported in this version.

Since:
1.1.08

Since:
1.1.08.

hexIDtoNum

public int[] hexIDtoNum
translate hex ID (hex coordinate) to an array index within hexLayout, which is sometimes called its "hex number". The numbers in here are the board's land hexes and also the surrounding ring of water/port hexes. Initialized in constructor. Length is >= MAXHEX. A value of -1 means the ID isn't a valid hex number on the board.

See Also:
numToHexID, nodeIDtoPortType
Constructor Detail

Board

public Board(java.util.Hashtable gameOpts,
             int maxPlayers)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a new Settlers of Catan Board.

Parameters:
gameOpts - if game has options, hashtable of GameOption; otherwise null.
maxPlayers - Maximum players; must be 4 or 6. (Added in 1.1.08)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxPlayers is not 4 or 6
Method Detail

makeNewBoard

public void makeNewBoard(java.util.Hashtable opts)
Shuffle the hex tiles and layout a board. This is called at server, but not at client; client instead calls methods such as setHexLayout(int[]).

Parameters:
opts - Game options, which may affect tile placement on board, or null. opts must be the same as passed to constructor, and thus give the same size and layout (same getBoardEncodingFormat()).

getHexLayout

public int[] getHexLayout()
Returns:
the hex layout; meaning of values same as hexLayout.
See Also:
getHexLandCoords()

getHexLandCoords

public int[] getHexLandCoords()
The hex coordinates of all land hexes.

Returns:
land hex coordinates, in no particular order.
Since:
1.1.08

getNumberLayout

public int[] getNumberLayout()
The dice-number layout of dice rolls at each hex number.

Returns:
the number layout; each element is valued 2-12. The robber hex is 0. Water hexes are -1.

getPortsLayout

public int[] getPortsLayout()
On the 6-player (v2 layout) board, each port's type, such as SHEEP_PORT. Same value range as in hexLayout. (In the standard board (v1), these are part of hexLayout instead.) Same order as getPortsFacing(): Clockwise from upper-left.

Returns:
the ports layout, or null if not used in this board encoding format
Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
getPortTypeFromNodeCoord(int), getPortCoordinates(int)

getPortsFacing

public int[] getPortsFacing()
Each port's facing, such as FACING_NW. Port Facing is the direction from the port hex, to the land hex touching it which will have 2 nodes where a port settlement/city can be built. Same order as getPortsLayout(): Clockwise from upper-left.

Returns:
the ports' facing
Since:
1.1.8
See Also:
getPortsEdges()

getPortsEdges

public int[] getPortsEdges()
Each port's edge coordinate. This is the edge whose 2 end nodes can be used to build port settlements/cities. Same order as getPortsLayout(): Clockwise from upper-left.

Returns:
the ports' edges
Since:
1.1.8
See Also:
getPortsFacing()

getRobberHex

public int getRobberHex()
Returns:
coordinate where the robber is

setPortsLayout

public void setPortsLayout(int[] portTypes)
On the 6-player (v2 layout) board, each port's type, such as SHEEP_PORT. (In the standard board (v1), these are part of hexLayout.) Same order as PORTS_FACING_V2: Clockwise from upper-left.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
getPortsLayout()

getPortTypeFromHexType

public int getPortTypeFromHexType(int hexType)
Parameters:
hex - the hex type, as in hexLayout
Returns:
the type of port given a hex type; in range MISC_PORT to WOOD_PORT. If called on a non-port hex, returns 0 (which is MISC_PORT).
See Also:
getHexTypeFromCoord(int), getPortTypeFromNodeCoord(int)

getPortFacing

public int getPortFacing(int portNum)
Get a port's facing. Facing is the direction from the port hex, to the land hex touching it which will have 2 nodes where a port settlement/city can be built.

Parameters:
portNum - Port number, in range 0 to n-1, Ordered clockwise from upper-left.
Returns:
facing (1-6), or 0 if not a valid port number. Facing 2 is FACING_E, 3 is FACING_SE, 4 is SW, etc.
Since:
1.1.08

nodeCoord -
Returns:
the type of port (in range MISC_PORT to WOOD_PORT), or -1 if no port at this node
Since:
1.1.08

getHexTypeFromCoord

public int getHexTypeFromCoord(int hex)
Given a hex coordinate, return the type of hex

Parameters:
hex - the coordinates ("ID") for a hex
Returns:
the type of hex: Land in range CLAY_HEX to WOOD_HEX, or DESERT_HEX, or MISC_PORT_HEX or another port type (CLAY_PORT_HEX, etc), or WATER_HEX.
See Also:
getPortTypeFromHexType(int), getHexNumFromCoord(int), getHexLandCoords()

getHexTypeFromNumber

public int getHexTypeFromNumber(int hex)
Given a hex number, return the type of hex

Parameters:
hex - the number of a hex (its index in hexLayout, not its coordinate), or -1 for invalid
Returns:
the type of hex: Land in range CLAY_HEX to WOOD_HEX, DESERT_HEX, or WATER_HEX, or MISC_PORT_HEX or another port type (CLAY_PORT_HEX, etc). Invalid hex numbers return -1.
See Also:
getPortTypeFromHexType(int), getHexTypeFromCoord(int)

getBoardWidth

public int getBoardWidth()
Width of this board in coordinates (not in number of hexes across.) For the default size, see BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL.

Since:
1.1.06

getBoardHeight

public int getBoardHeight()
Height of this board in coordinates (not in number of hexes across.) For the default size, see BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL.

Since:
1.1.06

getBoardEncodingFormat

public int getBoardEncodingFormat()
Get the encoding format of this board (for coordinates, etc). See the encoding constants' javadocs for more documentation.

Returns:
board coordinate-encoding format, such as BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL
Since:
1.1.06

getMinNode

public int getMinNode()
Get the minimum node coordinate in this board encoding format. Note that the maximum is currently MAXNODE, so it has no getter.

Returns:
minimum possible node coordinate
Since:
1.1.08

getAdjacentNodesToEdge

public java.util.Vector getAdjacentNodesToEdge(int coord)
Adjacent node coordinates to an edge, within range getMinNode() to MAXNODE.

Returns:
the nodes that touch this edge, as a Vector of Integer coordinates
See Also:
getAdjacentNodesToEdge_arr(int)

getAdjacentNodesToEdge_arr

public static int[] getAdjacentNodesToEdge_arr(int coord)
Adjacent node coordinates to an edge. Does not check against range MINNODE to MAXNODE, so nodes in the water (off the land board) may be returned.

Returns:
the nodes that touch this edge, as an array of 2 integer coordinates
Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
getAdjacentNodesToEdge(int)

the adjacent edges to this edge, as a Vector of Integer coordinates

getAdjacentEdgesToNode

public java.util.Vector getAdjacentEdgesToNode(int coord)
Get the valid edge coordinates adjacent to this node.

Returns:
the edges touching this node, as a Vector of Integer coordinates

getAdjacentEdgesToNode_arr

public int[] getAdjacentEdgesToNode_arr(int coord)
Get the valid edge coordinates adjacent to this node. In the 6-player layout, valid land nodes/edges are found on the outer ring of the board coordinate system, but some of their adjacent nodes/edges may be "off the board" and thus invalid.

Parameters:
coord - Node coordinate. Is not checked for validity.
Returns:
the edges touching this node, as an array of 3 coordinates. Unused elements of the array are set to -1.
Since:
1.1.08

getAdjacentNodesToNode

public java.util.Vector getAdjacentNodesToNode(int coord)
Get the valid node coordinates adjacent to this node.

Returns:
the nodes adjacent to this node, as a Vector of Integer coordinates

getAdjacentNodesToNode_arr

public int[] getAdjacentNodesToNode_arr(int coord)
Get the valid node coordinates adjacent to this node. In the 6-player layout, valid land nodes/edges are found on the outer ring of the board coordinate system, but some of their adjacent nodes/edges may be "off the board" and thus invalid.

Parameters:
coord - Node coordinate. Is not checked for validity.
Returns:
the nodes touching this node, as an array of 3 coordinates. Unused elements of the array are set to -1.
Since:
1.1.08

getAdjacentHexesToHex

public java.util.Vector getAdjacentHexesToHex(int hexCoord,
                                              boolean includeWater)
Make a list of all valid hex coordinates (or, only land) adjacent to this hex. Valid coordinates are those within the board data structures, within MINHEX to MAXHEX, and valid according to getHexNumFromCoord(int).

Coordinate offsets, from Dissertation figure A.4 - adjacent hexes to hex:

    (-2,0)   (0,+2)

 (-2,-2)   x    (+2,+2)

    (0,-2)   (+2,0)

Parameters:
hexCoord - Coordinate ("ID") of this hex
includeWater - Should water hexes be returned (not only land ones)? Port hexes are water hexes.
Returns:
the hexes that touch this hex, as a Vector of Integer coordinates, or null if none are adjacent (will not return a 0-length vector)
Since:
1.1.07

getAdjacentNodeToHex

public int getAdjacentNodeToHex(int hexCoord,
                                int dir)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The node coordinate adjacent to this hex in a given direction. Since all hexes have 6 nodes, all node coordinates are valid so long as the hex coordinate is valid.

Parameters:
hexCoord - Coordinate ("ID") of this hex
dir - Direction, clockwise from top (northern point of hex): 0 is north, 1 is northeast, etc, 5 is northwest.
Returns:
Node coordinate in that direction
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dir < 0 or dir > 5
Since:
1.1.08

getAdjacentHexToEdge

public int getAdjacentHexToEdge(int edgeCoord,
                                int facing)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The hex touching an edge in a given direction, either along its length or at one end node.

Parameters:
edgeCoord - The edge's coordinate. maxEdge is 0xCC in v1 and v2 encoding.
facing - Facing from edge; 1 to 6. This will be either a direction perpendicular to the edge, or towards one end. Each end has two facing directions angled towards it; both will return the same hex. Facing 2 is FACING_E, 3 is FACING_SE, 4 is SW, etc.
Returns:
hex coordinate of hex in the facing direction, or 0 if a hex digit would be below 0 after subtraction or above F after addition.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if facing < 1 or facing > 6
Since:
1.1.08
